codeSystems.name: BundleType

codeSystems.name: FacilityTypeCodeValueSet
codeSystems.title: Facility Type Code Value Set
codeSystems.description: This is the code representing the type of organizational setting where the clinical encounter,    service, interaction, or treatment occurred. The value set used for Healthcare Facility    Type has been defined by HITSP to be the value set reproduced from HITSP C80 Table 2-147.

codeSystems.name: PracticeSettingCodeValueSet
codeSystems.title: Practice Setting Code Value Set
codeSystems.description: This is the code representing the clinical specialty of the clinician or provider who    interacted with, treated, or provided a service to/for the patient. The value set used    for clinical specialty has been limited by HITSP to the value set reproduced from HITSP    C80 Table 2-149 Clinical Specialty Value Set Definition.

codeSystems.name: ClinicalUseDefinitionCategory
codeSystems.title: Clinical Use Definition Category
codeSystems.description: A categorisation for a clinical use information item.

codeSystems.description: Overall defining type of this clinical use definition.

codeSystems.name: CompositionAttestationMode
codeSystems.title: Composition Attestation Mode
codeSystems.description: The way in which a person authenticated a composition.

codeSystems.name: CompositionStatus
codeSystems.title: Composition Status
codeSystems.description: The workflow/clinical status of the composition.

codeSystems.name: CountryValueSet
codeSystems.title: Country ValueSet
codeSystems.description:
This value set defines a base set of codes for countries.   
   
   Note: The codes for countries are taken from    [ISO 3166](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html).

codeSystems.name: DiseaseSymptomProcedure

codeSystems.name: DocumentRelationshipType

codeSystems.description: The type of relationship between documents.

codeSystems.name: HTTPVerb
codeSystems.title: H T T P Verb
codeSystems.description: HTTP verbs (in the HTTP command line). See [HTTP rfc](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) for details.

codeSystems.name: LinkRelationTypes
codeSystems.title: Link Relation Types

codeSystems.name: IdentifierTypeCodes

codeSystems.description: A coded type for an identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

codeSystems.name: IdentifierUse
codeSystems.title: IdentifierUse
codeSystems.description: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known .

codeSystems.name: IngredientFunction
codeSystems.title: Ingredient Function
codeSystems.description: A classification of the ingredient identifying its precise purpose(s) in the drug product (beyond e.g. active/inactive).

codeSystems.name: IngredientManufacturerRole
codeSystems.title: Ingredient Manufacturer Role
codeSystems.description: The way in which this manufacturer is associated with the ingredient. For example whether it is a possible one (others allowed), or an exclusive authorized one for this ingredient. Note that this is not the manufacturing process role.

codeSystems.name: Interactant
codeSystems.title: Interactant
codeSystems.description: An interactant - a substance that may have a clinically significant effect on another.

codeSystems.name: InteractionEffect
codeSystems.title: Interaction Effect
codeSystems.description: A interaction effect of clinical use of a medication or other substance.

codeSystems.name: InteractionIncidence
codeSystems.title: Interaction Incidence
codeSystems.description: A categorisation for incidence of occurence of an interaction.

codeSystems.name: InteractionManagement
codeSystems.title: Interaction Management
codeSystems.description: A type of management for an interaction of a medication or other substance.

codeSystems.name: InteractionType
codeSystems.title: Interaction Type
codeSystems.description: A categorisation for an interaction between two substances.

codeSystems.name: JurisdictionValueSet
codeSystems.title: Jurisdiction ValueSet
codeSystems.description:
This value set defines a base set of codes for country, country subdivision and region    for indicating where a resource is intended to be used.   
   
   Note: The codes for countries and country subdivisions are taken from    [ISO 3166](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html)    while the codes for "supra-national" regions are from    [UN Standard country or area codes for statistical use (M49)](http://unstats.un.org/unsd/methods/m49/m49.htm).

codeSystems.name: CommonLanguages
codeSystems.title: Common Languages
codeSystems.description: This value set includes common codes from BCP-47 (see http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47)

codeSystems.name: LegalStatusOfSupply
codeSystems.title: Legal Status Of Supply
codeSystems.description: The prescription supply types appropriate to a medicinal product

codeSystems.description: This value set includes all drug or medicament substance codes and all pharmaceutical/biologic products from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar value set.

codeSystems.name: ProductClassification
codeSystems.title: Product Classification
codeSystems.description: This value set includes codes from the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System - provided as an exemplar value set.

codeSystems.name: ProductConfidentiality
codeSystems.title: Product Confidentiality
codeSystems.description: Confidentiality rating, e.g. commercial sensitivity for a Medicinal Product.

codeSystems.name: ProductContactType
codeSystems.title: Product Contact Type
codeSystems.description: Contact type for a Medicinal Product.

codeSystems.name: ProductCrossReferenceType
codeSystems.title: Product Cross Reference Type
codeSystems.description: Relationship to another Medicinal Product.

codeSystems.name: MedicinalProductDomain
codeSystems.title: Medicinal Product Domain
codeSystems.description: Applicable domain for this product (e.g. human, veterinary)

codeSystems.name: ProductNamePartType
codeSystems.title: Product Name Part Type
codeSystems.description: Type of part of a name for a Medicinal Product.

codeSystems.name: ProductNameType
codeSystems.title: Product Name Type
codeSystems.description: Type of a name for a Medicinal Product.

codeSystems.name: MedicinalProductPackageType

codeSystems.description: Types of medicinal product packs

codeSystems.name: SpecialMeasures
codeSystems.title: Special Measures
codeSystems.description: Extra measures defined for a Medicinal Product, such as a requirement to conduct post-authorization studies.

codeSystems.name: MedicinalProductType
codeSystems.title: Medicinal Product Type
codeSystems.description: Overall defining type of this Medicinal Product.

codeSystems.name: MimeTypes
codeSystems.title: Mime Types
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all possible codes from BCP-13 (see http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp13)

codeSystems.name: OrganizationType
codeSystems.title: Organization Type
codeSystems.description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate a type of organization.

codeSystems.name: PackageMaterial
codeSystems.title: Package Material
codeSystems.description: A material used in the construction of packages and their components.

codeSystems.name: PackageType
codeSystems.title: Package Type
codeSystems.description: A high level categorisation of a package.

codeSystems.name: ProductCharacteristic
codeSystems.title: Product Characteristic
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all observable entity codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar value set.

codeSystems.name: ProductIntendedUse
codeSystems.title: Product Intended Use
codeSystems.description: The overall intended use of a product.

codeSystems.name: PublicationStatus
codeSystems.title: PublicationStatus
codeSystems.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

codeSystems.name: QuantityComparator
codeSystems.title: QuantityComparator
codeSystems.description: How the Quantity should be understood and represented.

codeSystems.name: ReferencedItemCategoryValueSet
codeSystems.title: Referenced Item Category Value Set
codeSystems.description: This is the code specifying the high-level kind of document (e.g. Prescription, Discharge Summary, Report, etc.). Made up of a set of non-healthcare specific codes and all LOINC codes where scale type = 'DOC'.

codeSystems.name: RegulatedAuthorizationBasis
codeSystems.title: Regulated Authorization Basis
codeSystems.description: A legal or regulatory framework against which an authorization is granted, or other reasons for it.

codeSystems.name: RegulatedAuthorizationCaseType
codeSystems.title: Regulated Authorization Case Type
codeSystems.description: The type of a case involved in an application.

codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTRouteCodes
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Route Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all Route codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar.

codeSystems.name: SearchEntryMode
codeSystems.title: Search Entry Mode
codeSystems.description: Why an entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.

codeSystems.name: SecurityLabelExamples
codeSystems.title: Example set of Security Labels
codeSystems.description: A sample of security labels from [Healthcare Privacy and Security Classification System](http://hl7.org/fhir/R5/security-labels.html#hcs) as the combination of data and event codes.

codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTSubstanceCodes
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Substance Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all substance codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar value set.

codeSystems.name: TargetSpecies
codeSystems.title: Target Species
codeSystems.description: A species for which a medicinal product is intended.

codeSystems.name: Therapy
codeSystems.title: Therapy
codeSystems.description: A therapy.

codeSystems.name: TherapyRelationshipType
codeSystems.title: Therapy Relationship Type
codeSystems.description: Classification of relationship between a therapy and a contraindication or an indication.

codeSystems.name: UndesirableEffectClassification
codeSystems.title: Undesirable Effect Classification
codeSystems.description: A categorisation for an undesirable effect.

codeSystems.name: UndesirablEffectFrequency
codeSystems.title: Undesirabl Effect Frequency
codeSystems.description: A categorisation for a frequency of occurence of an undesirable effect.

codeSystems.name: UndesirableEffectSymptom
codeSystems.title: Undesirable Effect Symptom
codeSystems.description: An undesirable effect of clinical use.

codeSystems.name: UnitOfPresentation
codeSystems.title: Unit Of Presentation
codeSystems.description: The presentation type in which an administrable medicinal product is given to a patient.

codeSystems.name: WarningType
codeSystems.title: Warning Type
codeSystems.description: Classification of warning type.

codeSystems.name: ActCode
codeSystems.title: v3 Code System ActCode
codeSystems.description:
A code specifying the particular kind of Act that the Act-instance represents within its class.  Constraints:
The kind of Act (e.g. physical examination, serum potassium, inpatient encounter, charge financial transaction, etc.) is specified with a code from one of several, typically external, coding systems.  The coding system will depend on the class of Act, such as LOINC for observations, etc. Conceptually, the Act.code must be a specialization of the Act.classCode. This is why the structure of ActClass domain should be reflected in the superstructure of the ActCode domain and then individual codes or externally referenced vocabularies subordinated under these domains that reflect the ActClass structure. Act.classCode and Act.code are not modifiers of each other but the Act.code concept should really imply the Act.classCode concept. For a negative example, it is not appropriate to use an Act.code "potassium" together with and Act.classCode for "laboratory observation" to somehow mean "potassium laboratory observation" and then use the same Act.code for "potassium" together with Act.classCode for "medication" to mean "substitution of potassium". This mutually modifying use of Act.code and Act.classCode is not permitted.

codeSystems.name: HL7FormatCodes
codeSystems.title: HL7 ValueSet of Format Codes for use with Document Sharing
codeSystems.description: The HL7-FormatCodes value set is defined to be the set of FormatCode(s) defined by implementation guides published by HL7 and other SDOs. The use of a formatCode from the FormatCodes value set specifies the technical format that a document conforms to. The formatCode is a further specialization more detailed than the mime-type. The formatCode provides sufficient information to allow any potential document content consumer to know if it can process and/or display the content of the document based on the document encoding, structure and template conformance indicated by the formatCode. The set of formatCodes is intended to be extensible. The Content Logical Description is defined intentionally to permit formatCodes defined by other Standards Development Organizations to be added by inclusion of additional formatCode Code Systems.
